thread.title: Ryan Kelly dunk lifts Kobe-less Lakers over Trail Blazers in preseason game
thread.title_full: Ryan Kelly dunk lifts Kobe-less Lakers over Trail Blazers in preseason game - Press Enterprise

author: BILL ORAM
title: Ryan Kelly dunk lifts Kobe-less Lakers over Trail Blazers in preseason game
text:
By BILL ORAM / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 19, 2015 Updated: 10:51 p.m. LOS ANGELES – Overtime would have at least represented a reasonable make-up effort for ending the last game after just three quarters.
But Ryan Kelly would have none of it.
With 4.8 seconds remaining against the Portland Trail Blazers and the teams tied, Kelly took an inbounds pass, paused, faked a handoff to Jabari Brown, turned to the basket and saw a clear path to the hoop.
He drove and threw down a left-handed dunk with two seconds remaining that gave the Lakers a 104-102 victory.
“I didn’t figure they would give him the lane that open,” Lakers coach Byron Scott said. “He did a great job of reading it.”
The Lakers have won consecutive preseason games – Saturday’s 85-70 victory over Golden State by default, after the game in San Diego was called off due to a wet court – without Kobe Bryant.
The 37-year-old star continued to rest his bruised leg, a precaution more than anything with the regular season eight days away.
Kelly’s dunk might have stolen the show, but it was a play that probably shouldn’t have been needed.
The Lakers blew a nine-point lead in 45.2 seconds, capped by a blown inbounds play that led to a 3 by Portland’s Pat Connaughton with 4.8 seconds remaining to tie the game at 102.
“The takeaway from this game will be those last two minutes,” Kelly said, “when we made a bunch of mistakes which led to that end-of-game play having to happen.”
The Lakers will take any momentum they can get after winning a franchise-worst 21 games last season.
“I think that’s a big thing to get a little roll going into the season,” said Kelly, who was 2 for 4 for 9 points.
Jordan Clarkson led the Lakers with 17 points, while Portland All-Star Damian Lillard scored a game-high 20.
BRYANT PARKED The plan has always been to be cautious with Bryant, so the fact he has not played since suffering a bruise on his lower leg is little surprise.
Whether he suits up again before the start of the regular season on Oct. 28 remains a mystery.
